head.title: Metro Business; Car Firm Settles Bias Case

hedline.hl1: Metro Business; Car Firm Settles Bias Case

block.p: The United States Equal Employment Opportunity Commission and Toyota Logistics Services, which unloads 150,000 cars a year in Port Newark, have signed a consent decree resolving a lawsuit charging the company with sex and race discrimination in hiring.

The United States Equal Employment Opportunity Commission and Toyota Logistics Services, which unloads 150,000 cars a year in Port Newark, have signed a consent decree resolving a lawsuit charging the company with sex and race discrimination in hiring.

The agreement, approved last week by Judge John W. Bissell of Federal District Court, came 10 months after the commission brought a lawsuit against the company on behalf of Sandra Burrows, a black job-seeker who charged that race and sex discrimination barred her from being hired as a driver or auto accessorizer at the service center. Under the agreement, the company agreed to broaden the pool of potential workers.
